info.name: Fourier's Caustic
info.description:
Shockingly easy and wayyy faster than doing it some other way. Thank you to Robert (trirop) and Rory for teaching me the ways of the fourier transform and applying it to light propagation. 

(Runs much better on lower resolution)

renderpass.name: Image

renderpass.code:
#define R iResolution.xy
#define A(U) texelFetch(iChannel0, ivec2(mod(U,R)),0)
#define B(U) texelFetch(iChannel1, ivec2(U),0)
#define C(U) texture(iChannel2,(U)/R)
#define D(U) texture(iChannel3,(U)/R)
#define Main void mainImage (out vec4 Q, in vec2 U)
#define pi 3.14159265359
#define o vec3(1,0,-1)
#define cos(a) cos(mod(a,2.*pi))
#define sin(a) sin(mod(a,2.*pi))
#define ei(a) mat2(cos(a),sin(a),-sin(a),cos(a))
#define mul(a,b) vec2(a.x*b.x-a.y*b.y,a.x*b.y+a.y*b.y)
#define N 3
#define time sin(2.*pi*float(iFrame)/float(N))
#define WAVELENGTH (300.)
#define DEPTH (pi-time)
#define HEIGHT 1000.
